description:
NGC 1232 is an intermediate spiral galaxy in the constellation Eridanus, discovered by William Herschel.
The open clusters are easily visible on this picture.
Near NGC 1232, there’s NGC 1232a, its satellite galaxy, thought to be the cause of unusual bending in the spiral arms.

RA: 03h 09m 45s
DEC: -20° 34’ 46“
Location: Eridanus
Distance: 50 Mly
Magnitude: 9.83
Other designations: PGC 11819, ARP 41

Captured between November & December 2019
Fiel Of view: 32.2 x 22.1 arcmin
Total acquisition time of 26.5 hours.

Planewave CDK17
Technical Details
Location: El Sauce Observatory, Rio Hurtado, Chile
Dates of Capture November & December 2019
L 21 x 1200 sec
R 15 x 1200 sec
G 15 x 1200sec
B 15 x 1200sec
Ha 9 x 1800sec
Optics: Planewave 17“ CDK @ F6.8
Mount: Paramount ME
CCD: SBIG STXL-11002 (AOX)
Pre Processing: CCDStack & Pixinsight
Post Processing: Photoshop CC
title: NGC 1232 - HaLRGB
